Abstract: "A study explored the impact of a testing change designed to encourage deeper approaches to learning. In an engineering materials science course, an open-book final examination was used, with time and opportunities for colleague interaction. Student attitudes and outcomes were compared to those of students tested with a traditional closed-book test. Problems with such a change are discussed."
<citation>Caroline Baillie, Susan Toohey; The `power test': Its impact on student learning in a materials science course for engineering students; Assessment and Evaluation in Higher Education; 22; 1; 33; 1997</citation>

lom:keyword.lom:string: Innovation, Learning Processes, Open Book Tests, Science Education, Student Attitudes, Student Evaluation, Test Use
